hey guys I've taken my computer and I've got a black-and-white copy of the door
and I just pulled it out three and a half wide by four and a half tall and
I'll just go ahead and print that and I'll be ready for the next step so here
we go I printed it I've got my cheap dollar store foam-core and I'm gonna
take the bottom and line it up with the foam core on the bottom there and I've
got a ballpoint pen then I'm gonna use that to trace the design into the foam
core and this will give me a really nice detail from the door without having to
draw it by hand so just push just push make sure you give a lot of force when
you push into this don't rip the paper but you know enough force that will
transfer the design over to the foam core and just get all those little
details there's lots of details on the store so make sure you get them all and
just go through and pull out all those details into the door and what you're
done you'll have an impression of the door into the foam core now I'm going to
go back over with the ballpoint pen and push into the phone cord a little more
just so it'll get you have some depth to this it's nice that you have the
impression because then you can just trace over it in the foam core but I
find that if you do another if you draw over it again it'll it'll push into the
phone cord more and just give you more depth when you do the step for the
glowing runes on the door so you guys just go through and pull that detail out
you can have your little picture nearby for our reference all those little
details and little details you may have missing the first go and there we are
really really nice looks just like it okay so now here what we're going to do
is we're going to measuring out from the center to the edges and this is where
I'm going to make the edge of the door because it's three and a half wide so
and it's four and a half tall so make sure that I measure that out
just mark right into the foam core there and then I'll measure the halfway point
for the doors there we go we got our doors all set and
that's where we'll cut now I've cut them out with a sharp knife and you see the
doors will open like that so but I want to make the hinges of the door so I'm
just going to pull along with an ink pen kind of make an indent into the foam
core itself I'm gonna take my barbecue skewer and my
glue gun my hot glue gun here I'm a glue on that edge where I made the indent and
that'll just secure the skewer nicely into the foam core and the edges are a
little too long but I'm not worried about that right now
take off any excess hot glue and you can see I did leave the paper on the back of
these doors okay so here's my wall that the doors will go into I've kind of
crinkled it up to give it like a stone texture to the wall so I'll just measure
where those barbecue skewers are actually stick them into the corrugation
there stuck them into the corrugation I'll just measure the door itself
there we go that'll be the opening now I just cut that out
you want to make sure you don't cut out the corrugation where the where the
barbecue skewers will stick into and there we go we got it so see that's a
really nice cheap and easy way to do those hinges on there and it'll work
nicely when we have the base so here we go I've got it in there just for

a couple things it'll strengthen it up as well as give some texture to the wall
itself some like rock stone like texture so I'm just gonna use my large hot glue
gun and just pull it along kind of pull like veins of rock into the wall itself
so we'll just keep doing that till we're satisfied with it and there we go hey
